item.title: Re: Email verification changes: Verification email isn't being sent to mail so can't verify new account. Email entered correctly as password reset sent to correct email but not verification email. -lthompson38
Re: Email verification changes: thanks for looking after Wigle for us :) -computerb0y

Email verification changes: Due to extensive abuse, we've had make changes, including switching to an email-verification model on registration. This isn't our preferred solution, recent events have made it necessary. As always, if you have a specific use in mind, reach out to us, and please understand that the EULA applies to every user and exists entirely so that we can continue to make this project work. -arkasha
Re: Billion Mapped WiFi Networks: Congrats!! -Rouregre
Re: RF Hacker Sanctuary DEF CON 31 World Wide Wardrive: details in the interview here: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1858572275 -arkasha

Re: RF Hacker Sanctuary DEF CON 31 World Wide Wardrive: Can we get some sort of clarification or further explanation on how the scoring works? It says that it is based on "coverage". Can we have more detail on what that means please. My inference is that the data submitted during the contest time frame will be compared with existing data that has already been submitted and our score will be based on how much of a percentage of our data matches to the existing data. Is this correct? -K0R41
Re: RF Hacker Sanctuary DEF CON 31 World Wide Wardrive: If you actually mean "price" - no, it's free to join! perhaps you meant "prize?" -arkasha
Re: RF Hacker Sanctuary DEF CON 31 World Wide Wardrive: I know this might be a dumb question. but since this is a contest, would there be a price? -KevinKid4738

RF Hacker Sanctuary DEF CON 31 World Wide Wardrive: registration for the WWWD is open - see https://wigle.net/wwwdintro/DC31 if you're new and https://wigle.net/contest/DC31 if you're already a user. The contest begins at midnight, July 24th and end at noon July 30th (defcon standard time, even though weâ€™re just DC-adjacent) -arkasha
Re: Billion Mapped WiFi Networks: It grows \o/ GG user -CabinetVCase
Re: Billion Mapped WiFi Networks: Thats outstanding, awesome job to all involved. -wpa3
Re: Billion Mapped WiFi Networks: Congrats to the project and the whole famdamily that make all these #dotsOnMaps appear! -pejacoby
Billion Mapped WiFi Networks: Congrats to user 'vmbio' who posted the ONE BILLIONTH geo-located WiFi network! This project continues to delight, thanks to all the users! -bobzilla

Thanks a Billion!: Last week, WiGLE reached 1 billion WiFi Networks recorded. This is mind-boggling number, and we couldn't have done it without the community - in particular, LuciFerko, who submitted the 1-billionth network. Next up: the 1 billionth network with location data in the project (we're about 5.5m away at the time of writing) -arkasha

Re: Goodbye, Roamer: This talk and the year prior were the exact reasons that I started working in the wireless realm. I owe so much to Roamer, and Wigle, I can never express the thank you enough. We butted heads, we drank, we hacked things, and most of all we laughed. I can't watch a football game without hearing his "kind" words. Thanks for the memories!, He did it his way! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p6rPRIFCJaM -mellendic
